intro: Asphodelus microcarpus var. africanus, commonly known as the African bulbous asphodel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces tall, slender flower stalks that bear small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. This species is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
